result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Philip Charles Bidwell

records.addlTxt:
Defense counsel advises the Court the Defendant posted cash with the charging municipality. Court orders that $500.00 of the cash previously posted remain on deposit and the rest is returned to the remitter. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JSP and MCO. Court also issues an ORAL NO VIOLENT CONTACT order with AYB. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Kiefer.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Skwierawski, Br. 41.

Defendant Philip Charles Bidwell in court.  Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court for Philip Charles Bidwell.  Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Defense informs the Court a request for substitution of Judge has been filed. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  

Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 104200,
Payable Number: 1042674,
Receipt Number: 22RP043966,
Amount: $20.00
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
